thread.title: Arsenal trolled over the 'thousands' of empty seats at the Emirates for clash v Hull
thread.title_full: Arsenal trolled over the 'thousands' of empty seats at the Emirates for clash v Hull

author: Mark Jones
title: Arsenal trolled over the 'thousands' of empty seats at the Emirates for clash v Hull
text:
Sport Arsenal trolled over the 'thousands' of empty seats at the Emirates for clash v Hull Gunners fans voted with their feet during Saturday afternoon's early clash with the Tigers at the Emirates, and people noticed Share Maybe they'd come dressed as empty seats? (Photo: REUTERS) Share Get Arsenal FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
There was a lot going on during Arsenal's clash with Hull City at the Emirates on Saturday. 
Alexis Sanchez opened the scoring for the Gunners when he handled the ball over the line, before a late handball from Sam Clucas led to a second Sanchez goal from the penalty spot, which papered over the cracks during what was a fairly unconvincing Gunners display. 
But plenty of people weren't looking at the pitch. One fan in the stand (Photo: Getty Images) 
With Arsene Wenger still in the stands serving his touchline ban, there was a lot of focus on just who WASN'T there. 
Thousands of Gunners fans seemed to vote with their feet as they stayed away from the game, either in protest at Wenger or just because they didn't want to turn up. Some expensive empty seats (Photo: REUTERS) 
And on Twitter, people noticed. Ouch. Arsenal fans! Who would you prefer if Arsene Wenger leaves in the summer? 1000+ VOTES SO FAR
